item.title: Albuquerque Hot Air Balloon Ride at Sunrise
item.description: Watch daylight appear above the Rio Grand Valley during a sunrise hot air balloon ride from Albuquerque, and see the first rays illuminate the rugged Sandia Mountains. Take in stunning aerial views and dip low enough to skim the Rio Grande, then rise back up above the desert landscape. Touch town after a 1-hour flight, and begin the day with sparkling wine before returning to your launch site.

image.alt: Albuquerque Hot Air Balloon Ride at Sunrise

item.title: The Ghost Tour of Old Town - New Mexico's oldest Ghost Walk - Since 2001
item.description: Take a haunted tour of Old Town Albuquerque and learn about the many ghosts who have made the square home. Legends, folklore, ghost stories, and history come to life as you depart on an intriguing excursion through 313 years of haunted history. Historic buildings and dark alleys conceal long-forgotten secrets of battles, murders, hangings, hidden cemeteries, and more.

image.alt: The Ghost Tour of Old Town - New Mexico's oldest Ghost Walk - Since 2001

item.title: Santa Fe Ulitmate History Walking Tour
item.description: Get oriented to Santa Fe’s unique history, architecture, and culture on this top-rated walking tour. Explore the Santa Fe plaza area on foot, passing landmarks like the Loretto Chapel, Palace of the Governors, and Bario de Analco, plus places off the beaten path that most visitors miss. Hear stories not found in any guidebook, and get tips on how to make the most of your Santa Fe vacation.

image.alt: Santa Fe Ulitmate History Walking Tour

item.title: New Mexican Flavors Food Tour of the Santa Fe Plaza
item.description: Taste the highlights of Santa Fe during this food-themed walking tour. Meet your guide in the centrally located Santa Fe Plaza, and come hungry: you’ll visit multiple local food businesses, where you can enjoy enough samples to add up to a generous meal (plus drinks on the side). As you go, you’ll also see landmarks like the San Miguel Chapel and the Palace of the Governors.

image.alt: New Mexican Flavors Food Tour of the Santa Fe Plaza

item.title: Santa Fe Revisited
item.description: There are many Santa Fe tours out there, but this is the only one lead by a homegrown historian and author of eight books on the city. Take advantage of the guide’s deep knowledge of Santa Fe history and culture to gain a new perspective on landmarks like the Loretto Chapel, Canyon Road, Cross of the Martyrs, Route 66, and more. The tour delves into topics not often covered, including the Manhattan Project, spirituality, and Santa Fe’s role in World War II.

image.alt: Santa Fe Revisited

item.title: Wander New Mexico Food Tour - Downtown Plaza 'Sip & Savor'
item.description: Explore downtown Santa Fe's best food and wine venues on a half-day walking tour led by an informative guide. Get a taste of new developments in Santa Fe’s food scene and sample classic New Mexican flavors when you stop into several local eateries. You'll also visit landmarks like the Cathedral Basilica of Saint Francis, Loretto Chapel, and Palace of the Governors. Your guide shares commentary about the city’s history and the mix of cultures that have shaped its food culture throughout the leisurely walking tour.

image.alt: Wander New Mexico Food Tour - Downtown Plaza 'Sip & Savor'

item.title: PistachioLand Farm Tour
item.description: Those curious about pistachios—including the world’s largest pistachio at 30 feet tall—will find delight in PistachioLand, in Alamogordo. With this ticket, you’ll explore the 90-acre property via the orchard’s 14-passenger open-air shuttle, zooming among 12,000+ pistachio trees and rolling grape vineyards. After the tour, stop by the gift shop for souvenirs, gifts, and tasty free samples.

image.alt: PistachioLand Farm Tour

item.title: Far Flung Adventures Rio Grande Racecourse
item.description: Go white water rafting on the Rio Grande River in New Mexico on this half-day tour from Taos. Your guide provides all necessary gear and paddle instruction for your 5-mile trip, which can be scheduled for the morning or afternoon. Zip through class 3 rapids that provide a fun ride for all levels of experience, with light refreshments provided when you get off the river.

image.alt: Far Flung Adventures Rio Grande Racecourse

item.title: Small-Group E-Bike Adventure Tour through Hidden Santa Fe
item.description: See a different side of Santa Fe beyond the plaza on a fun and athletic e-bike tour that earns rave reviews from travelers. Cover more ground than you would on a walking tour, taking advantage of the bike’s battery-assisted boost to go farther without breaking a sweat. Visit places many tourists miss, like the Santa Fe Railyard and River Park that hugs the Rio Grande, while a guide shares insider history not found in the guidebooks.

image.alt: Small-Group E-Bike Adventure Tour through Hidden Santa Fe

item.title: Albuquerque Hot Air Balloon Rides at Sunrise
item.description: Albuquerque is world renowned for its hot air balloon festival. Most visitors only watch balloons from the ground but this tour offers the chance to soar into the air yourself. Watch the sun rise as you fly over the Sandia Mountains and toast the experience with a glass of bubbly.

image.alt: Albuquerque Hot Air Balloon Rides at Sunrise

item.title: Rio Grande Gorge Full Day
item.description: Take a full-day Rio Grande rafting adventure ideal for families and first-time rafters. Float through the Lower Gorge’s scenic Orilla Verde, where you’ll enjoy a delicious hot fajita lunch along the riverbanks. Experience the river’s broad canyon and rich habitat, where you can watch for wildlife like mule deer and birds of prey. Then, enjoy a thrilling encounter with whitewater during a 6-mile (9.6 kilometer) section of class 2-3 rapids.

image.alt: Rio Grande Gorge Full Day

item.title: 12pm - Public High Noon History, Legends & Lore Tour - Guided Old Town Stroll
item.description: Rather than wandering around alone, explore Albuquerque's Old Town in the company of someone who knows it best and can provide context. This small-group walking tour introduces you to the legends, lore and colorful characters of this historically rich neighborhood while taking you to all the most important landmarks.

image.alt: 12pm - Public High Noon History, Legends & Lore Tour - Guided Old Town Stroll

item.title: Turquoise Museum Visit
item.description: Learn all about turquoise during your time in the American Southwest with a visit to the Turquoise Museum in Albuquerque. Located in a modern 'castle' that is as interesting as the exhibits, the Turquoise Museum features a vast collection of turquoise jewelry and other pieces such as antique furniture. which you can explore on a self-guided tour.

image.alt: Turquoise Museum Visit

item.title: Santa Fe Architectural Walking Tour
item.description: Santa Fe has architecture unlike nearly any city in the United States—it’s dominated by adobe buildings but has diverse Victorian and Mission Revival styles. This tours offers a chance to learn about the architecture while taking a guided walk through the city’s back roads, residential areas, and art districts. Finish with a champagne tasting at Gruet Tasting Room at Hotel St. Francis.

image.alt: Santa Fe Architectural Walking Tour

item.title: Taste of Santa Fe Wine and Dine Lunch
item.description: Discover Santa Fe’s must-try bites—and learn about the city’s history and culture—on this decadent walking tour. Meet your guide before lunch at Santa Fe Plaza, and come ready with an appetite: you’ll visit three local eateries, where you can enjoy everything from spicy New Mexican fare to tasty local chocolates. As you go, you’ll also see landmarks like the New Mexico State Capitol, Palace of the Governors, and more.

image.alt: Taste of Santa Fe Wine and Dine Lunch

item.title: Sunrise Hot Air Balloon Tour in New Mexico
item.description:
Choosing our launch sights daily makes it a lot more likely your flight is successful. Ballooning is dependent upon the weather and having such a large radius we fly in gives us a much higher likelihood of having a slow soft landing.
We offer private flights as well as group flights. We can accommodate almost any requests and we would be happy to do so.

image.alt: Sunrise Hot Air Balloon Tour in New Mexico

item.title: 2-Hour Photography Class While Touring Downtown Santa Fe, Smart Phones Welcome!
item.description: Santa Fe is a photographer’s dream, so learn how to capture the city’s unique adobe architecture, enchanting desert light, and colorful streets like a pro. A trained photographer and longtime Santa Fe resident takes you to the most photogenic locations around the plaza and helps you get that perfect shot, whether you're working with a high-tech DSLR camera or a smart phone.

image.alt: 2-Hour Photography Class While Touring Downtown Santa Fe, Smart Phones Welcome!

item.title: Viator Exclusive: Gourmet Brunch in Santa Fe with Chef Carolina
item.description: Dining options in Santa Fe can seem endless, so remove the guesswork and start your day with a memorable meal at a specialty chef’s brunch not found at any restaurant. A local chef trained at the famously Le Cordon Bleu culinary school prepares a seasonal meal using high-quality ingredients that showcase Santa Fe’s unique cuisine drawn from Spanish, Mexican, and Native American flavors.

image.alt: Viator Exclusive: Gourmet Brunch in Santa Fe with Chef Carolina

item.title: Far Flung Adventures Scenic Half-Day Float
item.description: Soak up New Mexico’s high desert scenery from the water on a gentle rafting tour down the Rio Grande. Mild class II rapids are suitable for all experience levels, with plenty of calm stretches in between to admire sloping canyon walls, rock cliffs, and the desert ecosystems of the Orilla Verde National Recreation Area. Great for small groups and families with older kids, the outdoor adventure makes an easy day trip from Taos.

image.alt: Far Flung Adventures Scenic Half-Day Float

item.title: Taos Walking Tour
item.description: Explore the historical aspects of downtown Taos on this 1-hour walking tour of the town. Stroll through the streets, as you walk about half a mile (0.8 km) and learn about the people of the past. Hear stories of Kit Carson, Padre Martinez, Don Juan de Onate, Long John Dunn, and Doc Martin.

image.alt: Taos Walking Tour

item.title: Guided Bicycle Nature Tour of Albuquerque - Daily
item.description: See parts of Albuquerque that tour buses cannot reach, and cover more ground than is possible on foot. This bicycle tour introduces you to the nature and culture of Albuquerque. You'll explore some of the city’s best scenery, living cultures and unique eco-systems, and have a chance to dip your toes into the city's celebrated lifeline, the Rio Grande.

image.alt: Guided Bicycle Nature Tour of Albuquerque - Daily

item.title: Racecourse half day class 3 most popular in New Mexico
item.description: Feel the thrill of the Rio Grande’s rapids as you embark on a white-water rafting tour along the Rio Grande. Head to the launch site located in the northern New Mexico town of Taos and gear up for your adventure. Then, navigate class III rapids with your group and guide, admiring the desert landscapes while you paddle.

image.alt: Racecourse half day class 3 most popular in New Mexico

item.title: Santa Fe: Canyon Road Art & History Walking Tour
item.description: Discover Canyon Road, home to over 80 art galleries, on a guided tour through Santa Fe. Walk through a number of exciting galleries to give you a sense of what Canyon Road has to offer. Engage with many of the art pieces and have a chat with the local artists and gallery curators. Your tour is limited to 10 participants, which allows for a more personal experience.

image.alt: Santa Fe: Canyon Road Art & History Walking Tour

item.title: Private Hot Air Balloon Flights with Elevated New Mexico
item.description: Albuquerque is famed for its hot air balloon festival, so there's no better place to take to the skies. Rather than crowding into a basket with strangers, enjoy a personalized experience with this private hot air balloon flight. You'll enjoy sunrise views as you float through the air and celebrate your experience with an included toast upon landing,

image.alt: Private Hot Air Balloon Flights with Elevated New Mexico
